intro: Plectritis brachystemon, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed whiteweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has slender, branched stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Plectritis brachystemon is often found in temperate climates and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
